status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

worklogs.comment:
kevingurney opened a new pull request #2172: ARROW-2750: Add MATLAB support for reading numeric types from Feather files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2172
 
 
   Add MATLAB support for reading numeric types (i.e. [u]int[x][y], float, double) from Feather files. This is the first in a series of future feature submissions for Feather read/write support and other Arrow IPC integration with MATLAB.
   
   The associated pull request creates a top-level "matlab" directory in the Apache Arrow project. It also introduces a MATLAB function "featherread", which takes a Feather filename as input and returns a MATLAB table. featherread maps Feather datatypes to corresponding MATLAB datatypes.
   
   This initial pull request does not support null values.
   
   featherread.m calls the Arrow C+ APIs using MEX, MATLAB's facility for calling C/C+ code.
   
   See the README.md in the "matlab" directory for instructions on how to build the MEX interface. Currently, building on Windows using CMake is not fully functional, but the MEX interface can be compiled manually using the MATLAB "mex" command.
   
   A MATLAB install is required to be present on your machine to build the MEX interface.

----------------------------------------------------------------

kevingurney commented on issue #2172: ARROW-2750: Add MATLAB support for reading numeric types from Feather files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2172#issuecomment-400743229
 
 
   @xhochy, it is nice to meet you, and thank you for reviewing my changes!
   
   Regarding running MATLAB tests in Travis CI - this is definitely something we would love to be able to do, and we are currently investigating approaches to accomplish this.
   
   All of the source code included in this pull request has been checked in under the Apache Version 2.0 License, but a MATLAB license and installation is needed to build the C/C++ MEX code. I will follow up with my colleagues at MathWorks regarding the legal side of things.

   @wesm We are exploring providing a way to call a MathWorks cloud service to run MATLAB tests from a Travis build. While this is still under investigation, we were hoping that perhaps this project would be interested in piloting this technology.
   
   @tkelman The MATLAB Compiler Runtime is meant for running MATLAB compiled applications and not for running arbitrary MATLAB code, so that wouldn't be suitable for this particular use case.

   See the README.md in the "matlab" directory for instructions on how to build the MEX interface. Currently, building on Windows using CMake is not fully functional, but the MEX interface can be compiled manually using the MATLAB "mex" command.
   
   A MATLAB install is required to be present on your machine to build the MEX interface.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2208#discussion_r199630936
 
 

 ##########
 File path: matlab/FeatherReader.cpp

 @@ -0,0 +1,301 @@
+// Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+// or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+// distributed with this work for additional information

+// under the License.
+
+#include <arrow/io/file.h>
+#include <arrow/ipc/feather.h>
+#include <arrow/status.h>
+#include <arrow/table.h>
+#include <arrow/type.h>
+
+#include <mex.h>
+
+#include "FeatherReader.h"
+#include "FeatherType.h"
+
+namespace matlab {
+namespace arrow {
+namespace ipc {
+namespace feather {
+
+// MATLAB Arrays cannot be larger than 2^48
+static const uint64_t MAX_MATLAB_SIZE = static_cast<uint64_t>(0x01) << 48;
+
+// FeatherReader Constructor.
+FeatherReader::FeatherReader(const std::string& filename) : filename_{filename} {
+  // Open the given Feather file for reading.
+  Open();
 
 Review comment:
   As a rule, elsewhere in the codebase we don't do any work in constructors (https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#Doing_Work_in_Constructors). Since you're signaling errors that can fail to the mex runtime I would say this is an exception, but if there is a way to avoid a non-trivial constructor that would make things more consistent across the codebase

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.description:
Add MATLAB support for reading numeric types (i.e. [u]int[x][y], float, double) from Feather files. This is the first in a series of future feature submissions for Feather read/write support and other Arrow IPC integration with MATLAB.

The associated pull request creates a top-level "matlab" directory in the Apache Arrow project. It also introduces a MATLAB function "featherread", which takes a Feather filename as input and returns a MATLAB table. featherread maps Feather datatypes to corresponding MATLAB datatypes.

This initial pull request does not support null values.

featherread.m calls the Arrow C++ APIs using MEX, MATLAB's facility for calling C/C++ code.

See the README.md in the "matlab" directory for instructions on how to build the MEX interface. Currently, building on Windows using CMake is not fully functional, but the MEX interface can be compiled manually using the MATLAB "mex" command.

A MATLAB install is required to be present on your machine to build the MEX interface.
fields.summary: [MATLAB] Add MATLAB support for reading numeric types from Feather files
fields.environment: Tested on Debian 9, Windows 10, and macOS 10.13.

comments.body: Created GitHub pull request [https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2172] to address this.
I moved this to 0.11 as it does not need to block the 0.10 release
